snippet: The author of “Maine” and “Commencement” regrets reading “In Cold Blood”: “I’m incapable of going anywhere remotely rural without being up all night worrying that every creaking floorboard is Dick and Perry.”
abstract: By the Book interview with author J Courtney Sullivan, who says she remains frightened of rural areas after reading Truman Capote's In Cold Blood.
lead_paragraph: The author of “Maine” and “Commencement” regrets reading “In Cold Blood”: “I’m incapable of going anywhere remotely rural without being up all night worrying that every creaking floorboard is Dick and Perry.”

headline.seo: J. Courtney Sullivan: By the Book
headline.main: J. Courtney Sullivan: By the Book
